paper_metadata.title: MAIN TEXT
paper_metadata.extraction_summary: Extracted genetic variant information for KCNH2, including penetrance data.

individual_records.evidence_sentence: A pathogenic mutation in potassium channels was identified in 5 of 45 patients (11%): 2 (4.4%) in the KCNH2 gene (N588K, T618I).
A pathogenic mutation in potassium channels was identified in 5 of 45 patients (11%): 2 (4.4%) in the KCNH2 gene (N588K, T618I).

functional_data.summary: In vitro characterization confirmed functional effects.
assays: in vitro characterization using patch clamp techniques

variants.evidence_level: Strong evidence based on segregation and functional studies.
variants.additional_notes: Both mutations were identified in patients with Short QT Syndrome.
key_quotes: A pathogenic mutation in potassium channels was identified in 5 of 45 patients (11%): 2 (4.4%) in the KCNH2 gene (N588K, T618I).
Interestingly, the penetrance of mutations, defined by a QTc interval ≤360 ms, was 100% in the pedigrees with multiple carriers.

extraction_metadata.notes: All relevant data for KCNH2 variants were extracted successfully.
